question: Which was the motive behind the infamous "Munich massacre" in the 1972 Summer Olympics, Munich?
explanation: Israeli-Palestinian Conflict was the motive behind the infamous "Munich massacre" in the 1972 Summer Olympics, Munich. The Munich massacre was an attack during the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, West Germany, by eight members of the Palestinian terrorist group Black September, who took nine members of the Israeli Olympic team hostage, after killing two of them previously, and killing them along with a West German police officer. The motive was Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
